definition: to put on a hat/to be first/to dub

sentences.english: None of these champions remotely resembles the long-side illustration.
sentences.chinese: 插图显示没有一个冠军使用类似长的身体姿势的姿势。

sentences.english: Odds have evened between the champions.
sentences.chinese: 争夺冠军的两名选手得胜的机会均等。

sentences.english: The challenger showed the white feather as soon as he stepped into the ring with the champion.
sentences.chinese: 这位挑战者同冠军一踏进拳击场时就胆怯了。

sentences.english: I lay 100 dollars Brazilian team will be the champion.
sentences.chinese: 我赌100美元，巴西队将是冠军。

sentences.english: Orton defends the World Title on both shows.
sentences.chinese: 奥顿守世界冠军都显示。
1998年世界杯体操赛平衡木冠军。

sentences.english: The playoffs continue in this elimination scheme until a conference champion is crowned.
sentences.chinese: 这种淘汰制一直进行到决出分区的冠军。

sentences.english: I feel we've been robbed of two Scudetti.
sentences.chinese: “我感觉我们被抢走了两个联赛冠军”。
你会成为世界上炙手可热的冠军的。

sentences.english: Elephant is the champion, because he carries the farest.
sentences.chinese: 马是冠军，因为他跑得象风一样快。

sentences.english: Bronco was a bodybuilding champion who was imprisoned for murdering his wife.
sentences.chinese: 布兰槿是一个健美冠军，他因谋杀妻子而入狱。

sentences.english: 'We want to try for the title next year,' Mancini said.
sentences.chinese: “我们要为冠军而努力，明年”曼奇尼说。

sentences.english: Our constant aim will be to compete for silverware and championships.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远的目标都是获取奖杯和冠军。

sentences.english: It looks as if he will win the 1500-meter race.
sentences.chinese: 看起来他可能要获得1500米赛跑的冠军。

sentences.english: He gloried in his winning the championship.
A year later he was world champion - the youngest ever.
sentences.chinese: 一年过去了，他成为了有史以来最年轻的世界冠军。

definition: to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to seize the crown/fig. to win a championship/to win gold medal
to defend the crown (in sports championship)
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
